Overview

The prosperous city of Nehlya stands on an island west of the main continent. It is mainly inhabited by Humans from Vaaloria. Humans from other Kingdoms can be found living peacefully in the city.

Organisation

The City of Nehlya is organised in three main areas:

Nehlya itself

  • Trade District
  • Magic Spire
  • Military Quarters

Everyone who acquires their citizenship is allowed to live inside the walls. The wealthy and renowned and those under "special circumstances" can fill out the form to apply for citizenship. The gates are always open to everyone though.

The areas surrounding the walls

These areas are populated by those who still didn't manage to acquire their citizenship but are considered people of Nehlya as they are an important part of the city's economics. These people built farms in the surroundings of the city and supply the city with mostly food.

Politics

The city is led by the:

  • Governor
  • Council
    • Governor's Wife
    • Triangle of Command: Lead Summoner/Mage
    • Triangle of Command: Nautical Military Force (Officer)
    • Triangle of Command: Warriors of Nehlya (Officer)
    • Nehlyan Association of Trade
    • The House of Law
    • Voice of the Citizens

Religion and Beliefs

  • Even though some shrines can be seen around Nehlya, it doesn't have any official religion.

Architecture

Buildings are made mostly of stone and their architecture remains constant with some slight changes. Houses use one variation, shops use another, important public buildings use another variation, etc...

Types of Houses

Wealthy Houses

  • Always inside the walls.
  • Large Houses
    • Nobles and very rich traders usually own these.
  • Medium Houses
    • Merchants and some citizens live in these houses.
  • Small Houses
    • Owned by citizens and small-trade businessman.

Farm Houses

  • Outside of the city walls, where all the farms are.
  • Usually made out of wood, stone and hay (roof). These farm houses are usually small.

Shops

  • Inns
  • Pottery Shop
  • Fabric Store
  • Tailor's
  • Butchery
  • General Goods Shop
  • Leatherworker's Shop
  • Jeweler's
  • Blacksmith's
  • Medicine Shop

(Descriptions, shop count and names for each of the shop will be added later once the layout of the city is completely drawn.)

Public Buildings

  • The House of Law
    • Where all law matters are resolved.
  • Bank
    • Where the citizens of Nehlya store their wares and gold.
  • Auction House
    • Where most of the (player) trade is done, either directly or by leaving their goods with an employee of the House.
  • House of Equality
    • Everyone benefiting and contributing to Nehlya's well being is welcome in this house. Inside it, every social hierarchy disappears, a simple farmer is equal to a noble or even the governor himself.
  • Public Baths
  • Military Recruitment Centre
  • The "Docks"

Other buildings

  • The Palace
  • Military Training Grounds
  • Military Common House

Military

This city possesses a relatively big army for it's size. Many people chose to join the military forces in order to obtain their citizenship. Nehlya's military forces are divided in:

Triangle of Command

  • Leads everything related to warfare.
  • Constituted by:
    • One Mage or Summoner (The OMS)
    • One Officer of the NMF
    • One Officer of the WN

Order of the Mages and Summoners

  • Special gifted military force which relies on magic. There is always at least one member of this force in each platoon/ship in war times.
  • Summoners as Guards
    • Each district has one Summoner who uses his or her minions to help in keeping the law. This task is usually assigned to middle-grade students in the Order.

Nautical Military Force

  • Nehlya must have the largest nautical force of all the Independent Cities. Every ship's pilot is aided by a Mage specially instructed in the NMF and only the best can be part of a warship's crew, making it a very powerful force.

Warriors of Nehlya

  • Ground Military Force
    • Soldiers
    • Siege Weapon handlers
    • Cavalry
    • Archers
  • Guards
    • Regular town guards who patrol and enforce the law inside Nehlya.
